page.title: 16WESTFIELD MINE : POLLUTION
page.content: The excavations associated with Westfield pit have brought about {severe water pollution}which has affected both the water entering the pit and the streams flowing in the vicinity of the mining complex. The water which lies in the foot of the pit and the Lochty Burn which flows around the southern boundary of the mine are{bright red in colour and {can support no life at all.}(The water in the pit has a{ph value of 2.5 } - highly acidic ) Acids, in particular sulphuric acid, are being created in the ground waters entering the pit. Several streams which are bright red in colour enter the pit along natural aquafers. This polluted water also finds its way into the natural streams making the{Lochty {Burn}technically{one of the most {polluted water courses in Scotland. }
